subject: Re: Welcome to the family!
preview: Your message to chrispmadell@allstateunderwriting.com.au couldn't be delivered.   chrispmadell wasn't found at allstateunderwriting.com.au.       support Office 365 chrispmadell   Action Required  Rec

full_threads.body:
Your message to chrispmadell@allstateunderwriting.com.au couldn't be delivered. chrispmadell wasn't found at allstateunderwriting.com.au. support Office 365 chrispmadell Action Required Recipient Unknown To address How to Fix It The address may be misspelled or may not exist. Try one or more of the following:
  • Send the message again following these steps: In Outlook, open this non-delivery report (NDR) and choose Send Again from the Report ribbon. In Outlook on the web, select this NDR, then select the link "To send this message again, click here." Then delete and retype the entire recipient address. If prompted with an Auto-Complete List suggestion don't select it. After typing the complete address, click Send.
  • Contact the recipient (by phone, for example) to check that the address exists and is correct.
  • The recipient may have set up email forwarding to an incorrect address. Ask them to check that any forwarding they've set up is working correctly.
  • Clear the recipient Auto-Complete List in Outlook or Outlook on the web by following the steps in this article: Fix email delivery issues for error code 5.1.10 in Office 365, and then send the message again. Retype the entire recipient address before selecting Send.
If the problem continues, forward this message to your email admin. If you're an email admin, refer to the More Info for Email Admins section below. Was this helpful? Send feedback to Microsoft. More Info for Email Admins Status code: 550 5.1.10 This error occurs because the sender sent a message to an email address hosted by Office 365 but the address is incorrect or doesn't exist at the destination domain. The error is reported by the recipient domain's email server, but most often it must be fixed by the person who sent the message. If the steps in the How to Fix It section above don't fix the problem, and you're the email admin for the recipient, try one or more of the following: The email address exists and is correct - Confirm that the recipient address exists, is correct, and is accepting messages. Synchronize your directories - If you have a hybrid environment and are using directory synchronization make sure the recipient's email address is synced correctly in both Office 365 and in your on-premises directory. Errant forwarding rule - Check for forwarding rules that aren't behaving as expected. Forwarding can be set up by an admin via mail flow rules or mailbox forwarding address settings, or by the recipient via the Inbox Rules feature. Recipient has a valid license - Make sure the recipient has an Office 365 license assigned to them. The recipient's email admin can use the Office 365 admin center to assign a license (Users > Active Users > select the recipient > Assigned License > Edit). Mail flow settings and MX records are not correct - Misconfigured mail flow or MX record settings can cause this error. Check your Office 365 mail flow settings to make sure your domain and any mail flow connectors are set up correctly. Also, work with your domain registrar to make sure the MX records for your domain are configured correctly. For more information and additional tips to fix this issue, see Fix email delivery issues for error code 5.1.10 in Office 365. Original Message Details Created Date: 6/3/2019 5:37:06 AM Sender Address: support@wpperk.com Recipient Address: chrispmadell@allstateunderwriting.com.au Subject: Welcome to the family! Error Details Reported error: 550 5.1.10 RESOLVER.ADR.RecipientNotFound; Recipient chrispmadell@allstateunderwriting.com.au not found by SMTP address lookup DSN generated by: ME2PR01MB3505.ausprd01.prod.outlook.com Message Hops HOP TIME (UTC) FROM TO WITH RELAY TIME 1 6/3/2019 5:37:06 AM pconsumer-0059d6082a238f210 smtp.gmail.com ESMTPSA * 2 6/3/2019 5:37:09 AM mail-qt1-f171.google.com SMTP 3 sec 3 6/3/2019 5:37:09 AM mail-qt1-f171.google.com SY3AUS01FT014.mail.protection.outlook.com Microsoft SMTP Server (version=TLS1_2, cipher=TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384) * 4 6/3/2019 5:37:10 AM SY3AUS01FT014.eop-AUS01.prod.protection.outlook.com SYBPR01CA0191.outlook.office365.com Microsoft SMTP Server (version=TLS1_2, cipher=TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384) 1 sec 5 6/3/2019 5:37:11 AM SYBPR01CA0191.ausprd01.prod.outlook.com ME2PR01MB3505.ausprd01.prod.outlook.com Microsoft SMTP Server (version=TLS1_2, cipher=TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384) 1 sec

Hi Chris,

I wanted to personally reach to let you know how pleased we are to welcome you WP Perk!

We like to keep things super simple, so if you ever need to contact our team for support, you can either:

  • Send an email to support@wpperk.com
  • Jump onto our website - wpperk.com and use the live chat
  • Call us on 1300 072 134 (within Australia) or +61 1300 072 134 (outside of Australia)

All of our communications will be added to the support page within your account. We recommend you familiarise yourself with this.

So let's get started! Please head to https://wpperk.com/onboard/ to fill out our quick onboarding form.

If you need any help during this process, feel free to let us know.

Once we have your logins, we will migrate your site over to our servers, run our WordPress optimisation tweaks and test the performance. We will send you an email once your site is ready for you to triple check.

On the 1st of each month, you will receive a report with the key website metrics and can feel free to ask us to make any content changes, functionality enhancements or request some advice. If you have signed up for a Professional plan, you have 2 hours of devloper time each month included your package. If any tasks will take you over this limit, we will let you know before commencing and advise of any additional fees.

Thanks once again and we look forward to seeing the better version of your website come to life.
